III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Eligibility requirements
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12504
Section • (2) All the following must be in the case record before a
Description youth is placed in independent living:
• (c) That the youth's social service worker has
personally observed and determined that the
living situation is safe, and that the youth has a
bed and has access to cooking and bathing
facilities.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that Youth A is homeless.
Investigation The agency Program Manager was interviewed via telephone
on April 1, 2024. The Program Manager was informed of the
allegation. The Program Manager reported Youth A is doing well
in the program and is not aware of her being homeless. The
Program Manager referred me to Staff 1 who is the case manager
for Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on April 8, 2024. Staff 1
is an agency foster care worker for Youth A. Staff 1 reported
Youth A is not homeless and has not experienced homelessness.
Staff 1 reported Youth A tells people that she is homeless
because she does not have her own place to live. Staff 1 reported
Youth A has been offered a semi-independent living arrangement,
but she refuses, as she does not want to follow the rules of that
program. Staff 1 reported Youth A is currently living with a friend.
Staff 1 reported Youth A has lived with a different friend other than
who she is living with now. Staff 1 reported Youth A has
appropriate food, hygiene products and medications and reported
her well being is fine. Staff 1 reported she visits Youth A on a
weekly basis.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on April 10, 2024.
Youth A reported she is living with a friend. Youth A reported she
was homeless for a day or two when the people she was staying
with were suddenly evicted from the home. Youth A reported she
called Staff 1 when this happened and Staff 1 recommended
places she could stay until finding a more permanent place. Youth
2

A reported she then stayed with a friend for a few days before
moving to her current placement. Youth A denied she was living
on the streets and without a place to stay when evited. Youth A
reported she is okay and she sees Staff 1 two to three times a
month Youth A reported that her medical, food, and hygiene
needs are being met. Youth A reported that she has a bed. Youth
A reported Staff 1 takes her to various appointments and is
supportive. Youth A reported she has been approved for food
stamps and has a job interview on April 13, 2024. Youth A
reported she attends Vandercook High School online.
The Complainant was interviewed via telephone on April 10,
2024. The Complainant reported her supervisor recommended
she file a complaint when Youth A had told her she was homeless.
The Complainant added that Youth A reported she was moving
around and stays with friends.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
A review of the case file for Youth A was conducted. Social work
contacts document monthly visits by the case worker to Youth A’s
independent living placement. Social work contacts document that
Youth A’s needs are being met. Other contacts indicated face to
face visits outside of the living placement as well as telephone
calls between Staff 1 and Youth A.
Analysis Staff 1 reported Youth A is not homeless and has not experienced
homelessness.
Youth A reported she was homeless for one to two days but was
staying with friends at that time and denied that she had been
living on the street. Youth A reported she is okay and that her
worker is in regular contact with her and helps her with her needs.
The case file documents frequent interaction between Staff 1 and
Youth A as well as monthly visits to Youth A’s independent living
placement.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
